content.description: The Transmigration Dihedral is probably the second largest and most obvious feature at Old Castle Crag. As you climb you will transcend up the large left facing open book that is visibly seen from the road. This was the very first climb I ever did at this cliff. Originally I always felt it was 5.10 but once you have figured out the sequence and let go, it is only 5.9!!!
content.protection: Gear to 3 inches, Gear anchor to 3 inches.
content.location: Lovated on far right margin of the Dihedral Wall. Start as for birdshit chimney or 5.8 varied face out of left. Once you have established yourself in the beautiful corner, climb splitter handcrack until it is possible to pull through two mini roofs.

content.description: Proud geometric arête. Climb varied steep facial features, up to the magnificent orange pillar headwall. Crux comes high while climbing the steep and improbable, barn door, arête, on the left side of headwall.
content.protection: A gear anchor can be built at top of climb 15 feet back from top out. Gear to 3 inches.
content.location: Light Karma is located 15 feet to the left of the Transmigration Dihedral. Start on obvious shallow V slot mini dihedral, 20 feet left of birdshit chimney. Climb straight up blunt arête on slab 15 feet left large corner. Straight up to beautiful imposing steep arête.

content.description: Climbs amazing face features to a small roof, into a beautiful exposed, shallow left facing dihedral. Crux is probably pulling the roof into the dihedral.
content.protection: Gear to 3 inches. Gear anchor same as light and dark Karma.
content.location: Start as for Bemo's corner, after you pull through the tunnel or over it? Climb slightly up and right through vertical face to gain left facing dihedral!

content.description: Dark karma is the alternate thin face finish to Light Karma, which avoids climbing the Arête and climb straight up the middle of the orange pillar headwall. Thin, core, dime edge crimping, vertical madness!
content.location: Same as for Light Karma. Instead of climbing light Karmas arete, climb directly up black streaks in center headwall.

content.description:
Bemo's Corner is a great adventure climb for the area. It climbs the left most margin of the Dihedral Wall that separates all of the Main Wall from all of the Wild West.

It is characterized by tunneling through an awesome cave to start which brings you into a series of splitter dihedral corners. Due to its winding nature it is best to break into two pitches.  It is one of a few multi pitch routes that exist here but can be climbed in one long rope stretching pitch.
content.location: Located at the far left margin of the Dihedral Wall, starts just before the Central Cave. Same start as the Dharma Dihedral.
